CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;No violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . As a retired serviceman , the applicant was entitled to a ORG flat . The flat was not provided , and the applicant brought an action against ORG .

CARDINAL . In the course of the proceedings , on DATE , ORG offered the applicant to settle the case by providing him with a “ State housing voucher ” – a registered instrument entitling its owner to a housing subsidy . The applicant rejected this and several subsequent similar offers .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE ORG of Kemerovo ordered ORG to

“ provide the applicant ’s family of CARDINAL with a dwelling by way of , among other means , State housing vouchers valid for acquisition and construction of dwellings and financed by the Federal budget , and also by way of off - budget financial sources . ”
CARDINAL . This judgment became binding on DATE .

CARDINAL . In CARDINAL ORG several times offered the applicant the voucher . The applicant refused these offers and asked ORG to change the mode of enforcement to a cash payment , but on DATE ORG refused this request .
CARDINAL . On DATE a bailiff terminated the enforcement proceedings because the applicant had refused the voucher .
CARDINAL . Under section CARDINAL of LAW of DATE , a bailiff must enforce a judgment within DATE .

CARDINAL . NORP Under LAW of the ORG “ ORG ” of DATE , a housing voucher is a registered instrument entitling its owner to a housing subsidy . The vouchers are issued and liquidated by ORG . An owner of the voucher may open a blocked account in an authorised bank , and the ORG will credit to this account a subsidy for purchasing property .
